fields_of_interest: Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
head_office_address: General Lighthouse Authorities Research and Radionavigation Directorate Trinity House Tower Hill
eu_initiatives:
European Radio Navigation Plan 
Maritime safety applications of European Space Based Navigation , both Galileo and EGNOS  
Backup systems for Resilient Positioning, Navigation and Timing 
e-LORAN and alternative European collaborative terrestrial backup systems for GNSS and Galileo 
Motorways of the Sea 
e-Navigation and its interaction with e-Maritime 
European National Maritime Service Providers forum 
European Maritime Radionavigation Forum
organisation_name: General Lighthouse Authorities Research and Radionavigation Directorate (GLA R&RNAV)
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Other public or mixed entities, created by law whose purpose is to act in the public interest
membership:
International Association of Lighthouse and Aids-to-Navigation Authorities (IALA) 
http://www.iala-aism.org/
relevant_communication:
Innovation in Maritime Navigation - mariner/user driven R&D and support to Aids-to-Navigation (AtoNs) implementation. 
R&D of maritime resilient positioning, navigation and timing options for the UK, ROI and EU. 
Raising public awareness of the vulnerabilities of GNSS to space weather, ionospheric disturbance, RF interference including deliberate signal jamming and spoofing. 
Vulnerability of Aids to Navigation, safe navigation of shipping and wider cross-sector critical national infrastructures.
goals__remit: Public bodies with responsibility to DfT (UK) and DTTAS (RoI) for provision of statutory aids-to-navigation services for the safety of all mariners, protection of the marine environment and efficiency of shipping.
